required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Empirical Antibiotic and Outcome in Community-onset Bacteremia
clinical_study.official_title: Empirical Antibiotic and Outcome in Community-onset Bacteremia Caused by Third Generation Cephalosporin Resistant Enterobacteriaceae

lead_sponsor.agency: Phramongkutklao College of Medicine and Hospital

clinical_study.source: Phramongkutklao College of Medicine and Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Empirical antibiotic and outcome in Community-onset Bacteremia Caused by third generation cephalosporin resistant Enterobacteriaceae

detailed_description.textblock:
Prospective cohort study is conducted for monitoring outcomes and risk factors among community-onset bacteremia caused by third generation cephalosporin resistant enterobacteriaceae.
Primary endpoint is mortality rate among those who received initially inappropriate antimicrobial which switch to appropriate antimicrobial later when culture and antimicrobial susceptibility test reported among community-onset bacteremia caused by third generation cephalosporin resistant enterobacteriaceae.

primary_outcome.measure: Mortality rate among community-onset bacteremia caused by third generation cephalosporin resistant enterobacteriaceae

arm_group.arm_group_label: Community onset 3rd generation cephalosporin resistant entero
arm_group.description: Patient with Community onset third generation cephalosporin resistant enterobacteriaceae bacteremia who received inappropriate Antibiotic

arm_group.arm_group_label: Nosocomial onset 3rd generation cephalosporin resistant ente
arm_group.description: Patient with Nosocomial onset third generation cephalosporin resistant enterobacteriaceae bacteremia who received appropriate Antibiotic

study_pop.textblock: Patient with community-onset bacteremia caused by third generation cephalosporin resistant enterobacteriaceae. Age > 18 years

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient with Community-onset Bacteremia Caused by third generation cephalosporin resistant Enterobacteriaceae. Age > 18 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnancy
- Polymicrobial infection

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Phramongkutklao College of Medicine and Hospital
